stream_context.summary: Kaze worked almost exclusively on the factory-themed course "Oily Body Bay" (internal name varies in stream) polishing visuals and fixing engine-level bugs.  Tasks included importing Biobak’s rebuilt assets, adding dynamic lights, building a sparkle-along-cable effect, repairing color errors on the ‘fuzzy-dizzy’ shader, and installing a bespoke elevator camera.  The session ended with a short bug-triage list and a plan to finish the boss room and factory lighting before returning to the stalled Ice Castle next week.

development_findings.summary: Imported the complete visual rebuild of the factory level created by Biobak, including office, underground oil zone and secret room.
development_findings.quote: I imported all the assets and there's some assets Biobak still wants to make, but so far so good.

development_findings.summary: Added real-time window, ceiling and underground lighting; discovered an unfixable GlideN64 bug that stops per-ball lightmaps and overlaps the life-bar.
development_findings.quote: It's supposed to light up each ball individually, but GlideN has a bug here.

development_findings.summary: Memory/DMA pointer glitch in the underground area breaks music and animations; root cause still unknown.
development_findings.quote: It looks like some of the ROM pointers break, which breaks the music and the animations.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a spline-based sparkle effect that runs along overhead power lines; used cloned Marios as debug markers; bug was a missing square-root in distance math and is now fixed.
development_findings.quote: Oh, I forgot the SQR, okay now it works. I'm not even gonna test if it works, I just know it works.

development_findings.summary: Corrected rim-color on world decals during the ‘fuzzy-dizzy’ effect by sampling exact vertex colours in Blender 4 and syncing them to prim colour at runtime.
development_findings.quote: If I did everything right, then the rim will now be the same color.

development_findings.summary: Special elevator camera added; camera and collision were shifted 40 units inward to avoid geometry clipping; elevator still needs custom music.
development_findings.quote: We need the camera like here maybe… yeah this works.  Next: add the elevator music inside the elevator.

development_findings.summary: Found and started fixing a soft-lock where Mario’s safe position updated while hanging from a ledge; may be tied to down-warps.
development_findings.quote: Sometimes you can get into a situation where Mario was soft-locked… I’m looking at the code now.

development_findings.summary: Performance on real N64 remains stable or slightly better because Biobak removed many redundant textures.
development_findings.quote: The performance is basically not moved at all. If anything, it's slightly better because Biobak removed a lot of textures.

development_findings.summary: Planned future levels: Crystal 14 will be a Space Casino; Crystal 15 a cardboard Papercraft course.
development_findings.quote: Crystals 14 is going to be the Space Casino and Crystals 15 is going to be a Paper Craft level.

development_findings.summary: Blender 4 broke several workflows (vertex-colour eyedropper, UI); team has temporary work-arounds but Kaze is unhappy with upgrade.
development_findings.quote: Oh, we're on the new Blender 4 and I am not a fan of it. They messed up some important things.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s biggest personal pain point is German bureaucracy—he left Germany three years ago but still deals with paperwork.
context_findings.quote: I just turn into a sad cat when I have to deal with German bureaucracy.

context_findings.summary: He is openly a ‘cat person,’ despises Super Mario Sunshine for interruptive cut-scenes, and recently discovered he dislikes Five Nights at Freddy’s.
context_findings.quote: I have so much hatred in my heart for Super Mario Sunshine… every single time the game takes control away from me, it just feels like a small kick to my balls.

context_findings.summary: Feels exhausted by mid-afternoon because he codes before streaming; reluctant to spend money on new clothes despite outgrowing them.
context_findings.quote: It's only 3:30, but I'm feeling so exhausted already… I don't like spending money.

context_findings.summary: Lives in Canada now (inferred from kebab discussion) and misses German-style döner kebab.

biobak.summary: Rebuilt the entire factory course geometry and removed redundant textures, improving performance.
biobak.quote: Performance is basically not moved at all. If anything, it's slightly better because Biobak removed a lot of textures.

biobak.summary: Provided new fan turbine models that replaced placeholder versions.
biobak.quote: Here are yours. That looks a lot better. That is not my fan. Paternity test has come out. It is in fact not your fan.

biobak.summary: Guided Kaze on how to pick vertex colours in Blender 4 during the rim-colour fix.
biobak.quote: Switch to the second render mode and change it to attributes-vertex — that's what I understand.

zeina.summary: Present mainly as moral support; left mid-stream because ‘mom said’ she had to go, illustrating personal life/work overlap.
zeina.quote: See ya Zeina. Zeina has to go because her mom said, ‘Nope, you're done.’

key_stories.title: Getting Sparkles to Follow the Power Lines
key_stories.summary: Kaze wanted decorative sparkles to travel along factory cables. Initial math errors sent debug ‘Mario’ markers to random spots. After isolating the distance calculation he realized he’d omitted a square-root, fixed it, and the effect now works.
key_stories.challenge: Debug why particles were spawning in wrong positions.
key_stories.process: Inserted visible Mario clones, printed waypoint data, isolated math; discovered missing sqrt in distance formula.
key_stories.outcome: Sparkles now glide correctly; effect approved for final level.
key_stories.key_quote: Oh, I forgot the SQR, okay now it works.

key_stories.title: Blender 4 Vertex-Colour Setback
key_stories.summary: Upgrading to Blender 4 broke Kaze’s usual method of reading vertex colours, causing wrong rim colours on the fuzzy-dizzy shader. With chat (mainly Biobak) he discovered a hidden UI mode that exposes the data and synced prim colours in-game.
key_stories.challenge: Couldn’t sample exact vertex colours in Blender 4, leading to visual artifacts.
key_stories.process: Tried multiple UI modes, took advice from Biobak, located the attribute panel, exported fix, updated runtime code.
key_stories.outcome: Rim matches world colour; fuzzy effect looks intentional.
key_stories.key_quote: That is exactly what I needed.

key_stories.title: Elevator Camera & Collision Rework
key_stories.summary: Players could clip the camera into walls when jumping in the factory elevator. Kaze wrote a hard-coded camera node 40 units back and shifted the elevator collision the same amount, preventing clipping and preserving cinematic view.
key_stories.challenge: Camera clipping and awkward views inside elevator.
key_stories.process: Experimented with camera placement, adjusted hardPositions array, moved collision mesh, compiled and tested.
key_stories.outcome: Stable, cinematic elevator view; to-do: add elevator music.
key_stories.key_quote: We need the camera like here maybe… yeah this works.
